body_html:
Thanks! You could just capture and save the RNG state to a temporary variable (torch.cuda.get_rng_state) and output it after detecting failure.
Or if you just have the probabilities, that would be cool, too.

body:
Thanks! You could just capture and save the RNG state to a temporary variable (torch.cuda.get_rng_state) and output it after detecting failure.
Or if you just have the probabilities, that would be cool, too.
